{{Infobox military unit |unit_name=''65. Infanterie-Division''
German 65th Infantry Division |image=[[File:65. Infanterie Division.png|200px]] |caption=65. Infanterie Division Vehicle Insignia |country={{flagicon|Nazi Germany}} [[Nazi Germany]] |allegiance= |type=[[Division (military)|Division]] |branch=[[German Army (Wehrmacht)|Heer]] |dates=July 1942 – 22 April 1945 |specialization=[[Infantry]] |decorations=Referenced in the [[Wehrmachtbericht]] |command_structure= |size= |current_commander= |garrison= |ceremonial_chief= |nickname= |motto= |colors= |march= |mascot= |battles=[[World War II]] *[[Italian Campaign (World War II)|Italian Campaign]] *[[Moro River Campaign]] *[[Operation Shingle|Battle of Anzio]] *[[Operation Diadem]] *[[Gothic Line|Gothic Line Offensive]] *[[Spring 1945 offensive in Italy]] |notable_commanders=[[Gustav Heistermann von Ziehlberg]]
[[Hellmuth Pfeifer]] |anniversaries= }} The '''65th [[Infantry]] Division''' ({{lang-de|65. Infanterie-Division}}) was a [[Germany|German]] [[division (military)|division]] in [[World War II]]. It was formed in July 1942. ==Orders of Battle== ===65. Infanterie-Division 1943=== *Infanterie-Regiment 145 *Infanterie-Regiment 146 *Panzerjäger- und Aufklärungs-Abteilung 165 *Artillerie-Regiment 165 *Pionier-Battalion 165 *Divisions-Nachrichten-Abteilung 165 *Divisions-Nachschubführer 165 ===65. Infanterie-Division 1944=== *Grenadier-Regiment 145 *Grenadier-Regiment 146 *Grenadier-Regiment 147 *Divisions-Füsilier-Battalion 65 *Panzerjäger-Abteilung 165 *Artillerie-Regiment 165 *Feldersatz-Battalion 165 *Pionier-Battalion 165 *Divisions-Nachrichten-Abteilung 165 *Divisions-Nachschubführer 165 ==Commanding officers== *Generalleutnant Hans Bömers, 10 July 1942 – 1 January 1943 *Generalleutnant Wilhelm Rupprecht, 1 January 1943 – 31 May 1943 *Generalleutnant [[Gustav Heistermann von Ziehlberg]], 31 May 1943 – 1 December 1943 *Generalleutnant [[Hellmuth Pfeifer]], 1 December 1943 – 22 April 1945 == References == ;Citations {{reflist|2}} ;Bibliography {{Refbegin}} * ''Die Wehrmachtberichte 1939–1945 Band 3, 1. Januar 1944 bis 9. Mai 1945'' (in German). München: Deutscher Taschenbuch Verlag GmbH & Co. KG, 1985. ISBN 3-423-05944-3. {{Refend}} ==External links== *{{Cite web|work=Lexikon der Wehrmacht|title=65. Infanterie-Division|url=http://www.lexikon-der-wehrmacht.de/Gliederungen/Infanteriedivisionen/65ID.htm|accessdate=14 January 2011}} {{Infantry Divisions of the Wehrmacht}} {{Knight's Cross recipients of the 65th ID}} {{Subject bar | portal1=Military of Germany | portal2=World War II }} {{DEFAULTSORT:65th Infantry Division (Wehrmacht)}} [[Category:Infantry divisions of Germany during World War II|0*065]] [[Category:Military units and formations established in 1942]] [[Category:Military units and formations disestablished in 1945]]
